messages.title: Labour will support older people
messages.content: You'll get dignity and respect in old age with a Labour government. Labour will freeze gas and electricity prices until 2017, saving the average household £120 - and force the energy firms to cut bills this winter.

messages.title: Labour's new rules on immigration
messages.content: Labour’s new rules mean that people who come to the UK won't be able to claim benefits for at least two years.

messages.title: Labour's plan to boost your family finances
messages.content: Families are £1,600 a year worse off under David Cameron. Sally understands the strain families are under, because she's been helping families with the cost of living.

messages.title: Labour will support private renters
messages.content: Nine million people now rent and need protection. Labour will legislate to make three year tenancies the norm, with a ceiling on rent increases.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour will freeze gas and electricity prices until 2017 and force energy firms to cut bills.
Labour will cut business rates, set up a British Investment Bank, and guarantee a swift payment process.
Expanding apprenticeships and reducing university tuition fees.
Focus on regenerating the local town and resolving local despair.
A call for action on dementia care, highlighting the need for improved patient care services.
Supporting families strained by the cost of living and tackling low wages.
Labour aims to protect renters by legislating for three year tenancies and ceiling on rent increases.
Labour plans to secure and improve NHS services, including general care and cancer treatment.

issues.education: Labour has recently announced a fully-funded £3,000 cut in university tuition fees, from £9,000 to £6,000, helping students to study with the cost of college halved also by 2020.
issues.health: Sally Keeble, Labour’s candidate in Northampton North, views are clear choices on the NHS and why it is so important to make the right decisions. Sally’s fully funded plan for the NHS - financed by a tax on properties worth over £2 million - will secure and improve NHS services for patients.
issues.immigration: Labour’s new rules mean that people who come to the UK won't be able to claim benefits for at least two years.

housing.content: Labour will legislate to make three year tenancies the norm, with a ceiling on rent increases.

images.caption: Images within the leaflet featuring Sally Keeble and local residents or groups presumably.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet includes a repeated emphasis on local issues and Sally's commitment to improving local services.
